Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
d = ($ :: #_L x0) / ($ :: # :: #_R y0) : list nat * list nat
P = [d; e] ++ map (fun '(x / y) => #_L x / #_R y) (filter (fun '(x / y) => is_cons x || is_cons y) (x0 / y0 :: R)) : list (list nat * list nat)
P_inv : forall c : list nat * list nat, c el P -> c = d \/ c = e \/ (exists x y : string, x / y el x0 / y0 :: R /\ c = #_L x / #_R y /\ x / y <> [] / [])
hash_l = fix hash_l (x : string) : list nat := match x with | [] => [] | a :: x0 => # :: a :: hash_l x0 end : string -> list nat
hash_r = fix hash_r (x : string) : list nat := match x with | [] => [] | a :: x0 => a :: # :: hash_r x0 end : string -> list nat
split_inv : forall (X : Type) (u z x y : list X) (s : X), u ++ z = x ++ s :: y -> ~ s el u -> exists x' : list X, x = u ++ x'
list_prefix_inv : forall (X : Type) (a : X) (x u y v : list X), ~ a el x -> ~ a el u -> x ++ a :: y = u ++ a :: v -> x = u /\ y = v
in_split : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), x el l -> exists l1 l2 : list A, l = l1 ++ x :: l2
app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), a :: x ++ y = (a :: x) ++ y
concat_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : list A) (l : list (list A)), concat (x :: l) = x ++ concat l
sym = fix sym (R : stack nat) : list nat := match R with | [] => [] | x / y :: R0 => x ++ y ++ sym R0 end : stack nat -> list nat
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = [a] -> x = [] /\ y = [a] \/ x = [a] /\ y = []
app_inj_tail : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a b : A), x ++ [a] = y ++ [b] -> x = y /\ a = b
filter_fst : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> bool) (x : X) (A : list X), p x = true -> filter p (x :: A) = x :: filter p A
in_elt : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l1 l2 : list A), x el l1 ++ x :: l2
Facts.in_split : forall (X : Type) (a : X) (x : list X), a el x -> exists y z : list X, x = y ++ [a] ++ z
remove_app : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (x : A) (l1 l2 : list A), remove eq_dec x (l1 ++ l2) = remove eq_dec x l1 ++ remove eq_dec x l2
destruct_list : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), {x : A & {tl : list A | l = x :: tl}} + {l = []}
MPCPb = fun '(x / y / P) => exists A : stack bool, A <<= x / y :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : PCP.card bool * stack bool -> Prop
MPCP = fun '(x / y / P) => exists A : stack nat, A <<= x / y :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : PCP.card nat * stack nat -> Prop
fresh = fix fresh (l : list nat) : nat := match l with | [] => 0 | x :: l0 => S x + fresh l0 end : list nat -> nat Arguments fresh _%list_scope
rev_app_distr : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A), rev (x ++ y) = rev y ++ rev x
tau2_inv : forall (a : nat) (B : stack nat) (z : list nat), tau2 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list nat, y / (a :: x) el B
tau1_inv : forall (a : nat) (B : stack nat) (z : list nat), tau1 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list nat, (a :: x) / y el B
app_cons_not_nil : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), [] <> x ++ a :: y
